meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be predicted or foreseen.
meanings.sent1: The predictability of the sunrise brings comfort and routine to our mornings.
meanings.sent2: The predictability of the bus schedule helps commuters plan their day.
meanings.sent3: The predictability of my dog's reaction to the doorbell always makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: The predictability of the waves crashing against the shore is like nature's own metronome.
meanings.sent5: The predictability of the ticking clock echoed through the empty room.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is able to be anticipated or expected.
meanings.sent1: The predictability of her mood swings made it easier to navigate their relationship.
meanings.sent2: The predictability of the weather in this region allows farmers to plan their crops accordingly.
meanings.sent3: The predictability of the magician's tricks added a fun element to the show.
meanings.sent4: The predictability of the traffic patterns in the city can be compared to a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The predictability of the train schedule saved him from missing his stop.
